title: OpenAI Vector Store Integration
description: Use Apify's dataset and update OpenAI Vector Store (for OpenAI Assistant V2)

vectorStoreId.title: Vector Store ID
vectorStoreId.description: Vector Store ID where the data will be stored

assistantId.title: Assistant ID
assistantId.description:
The ID of an OpenAI Assistant. This parameter is required only when a file exceeds the OpenAI size limit of 5,000,000 tokens (as of 2024-04-23).

 When necessary, the model associated with the assistant is utilized to count tokens and split the large file into smaller, manageable segments.

datasetFields.title: A list of dataset fields which should be selected from the dataset
datasetFields.description:
A list of dataset fields which should be selected from the items, only these dataset fields will remain in the resulting record objects.

 For example, when using the website content crawler, you might select dataset fields such as `text` and `url`, and `metadata.title` among others, to be included in the vector store file.

fileIdsToDelete.title: Array of vector store file ids to delete
fileIdsToDelete.description: Delete specified file ids associated with vector store. This can be useful when one needs to delete files that are no longer needed.

filePrefix.title: Delete/Create vector store files with a prefix
filePrefix.description: Using a file prefix streamlines the management of vector store file updates by eliminating the need to track each file's ID. For instance, if you set the filePrefix to 'apify-advisor', the Actor will initially locate all files in the vector store with this prefix. Subsequently, it will delete these files and create new ones, also prefixed accordingly.

saveCrawledFiles.title: Save crawled files (docs, pdf, pptx) to OpenAI File Store
saveCrawledFiles.description: Enables saving files from Apify's key-value store to OpenAI's file store. Useful when utilizing Apifyâ€™s website content crawler with the 'saveFiles' option, allowing the found files to be directly store and used in the assistant.

datasetId.title: Dataset ID
datasetId.description: The Dataset ID is provided automatically when the actor is set up as an integration. You can fill it in explicitly here to enable debugging of the actor

keyValueStoreId.title: Key-value store ID
keyValueStoreId.description: Apify's key value store ID is provided automatically when the actor is set up as an integration. You can fill it in explicitly here to enable debugging of the actor

saveInApifyKeyValueStore.title: Save all files in the Apify key-value store
saveInApifyKeyValueStore.description: Save all created files in the Apify Key-Value Store to easily check and retrieve all files (this is typically used when debugging)
